topic.chunk: %product% is currently in Early Access, which means it may be not reliable, work not as intended, and contain errors. Any use of the EAP product is at your own risk.
Your feedback is very welcome in our issue tracker or at qodana-support@jetbrains.com.
By using %product%, you agree to the JetBrains EAP user agreement and JetBrains privacy policy.

Running analysis locally is a resource-intensive operation. If you experience issues, consider increasing the Docker Desktop runtime memory limit, which by default is set to 2 GB. See the Docker Desktop documentation for Windows and Mac.
%linter% supports %supported-techs%. Eventually, all languages and technologies covered by JetBrains IDEs will be added.
Qodana Playground provides several example projects analyzed by %linter%.
The Qodana UI can be part of the CI user interface in case your CI supports the UI extension. If it doesn't, you can spin the Qodana UI on your own following the guidelines.

This command will run the analysis on your source code and start the web server to provide a convenient view of the results. Open http://localhost:8080 in your browser to examine the found problems and performed checks. Here you can also reconfigure the analysis. See the for details. When done, you can stop the web server by pressing Ctrl-C in the Docker console.

The general workflow and configuration options are basically the same for all Qodana IntelliJ Docker images. In the following examples, replace jetbrains/qodana-<linter> with a linter of your choice, for example, jetbrains/qodana-jvm. For details on getting started with a specific linter, see .

To be able to run the analysis, make sure the project can be successfully built and run in the desired environment, that is, a JRE is properly configured, project dependencies are installed, build scripts or startup tasks are executed, and so on.

Consider using a fail threshold to make the build fail when a certain number of problems is reached, and baseline mode, in which each new Qodana IntelliJ run is compared to some initial run selected as a "baseline". Running as non-root is also supported.
